item.title: Ridge and Lasso Regression
item.description: body { text-align: justify} Overfitting In statistics, overfitting is the production of an analysis that corresponds too closely or exactly to a particular set of data, and may therefore fail to fit additional data or predict future observations reliably. An overfitted model is a statistical model that contains more parameters than can be justified by the data. Overfitting is the use of models or procedures that violate Occamâ€™s razor, for example by including more adjustable parameters than are ultimately optimal, or by using a more complicated approach than is ultimately optimal.
